item.title: Senate committee features climate disinformation, the Atlas Network, and Dr Karl's clash with One Nation
item.description: The scourge of AI-slopaganda, viral disinformation campaigns and online attacks against individuals and institutions is going to get far worse before it gets better, if the latest public hearings on the topic are any indication.

item.title: Danielle Scott's Winter Olympic silver ends years of pain
item.description: In this most tension-filled Winter Olympic sport, it's no wonder tears are a by-product of both success and failure. Thankfully for Dani Scott, this time she was crying tears of pure joy.

item.title: Renewable energy company abandons native title court application over Darwin solar farm
item.description: A renewable energy company planning to build a solar farm near Darwin withdraws a court application that traditional owners argued would "erase" their rights.

item.title: Could SA Liberal leader Ashton Hurn lose her seat at the next election?
item.description: It's an almost unthinkable scenario, but the fact it's even being discussed shows the extent of the Liberal Party's predicament.

item.title: Fiji's former prime minister Frank Bainimarama charged with inciting mutiny
item.description: Long-serving Fiji prime minister Frank Bainimarama and a former police commissioner will face court on Tuesday on charges of mutiny.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Dog invades cross-country skiing, Americans get engaged as Ally Hickman feels the pain — day 12 quick hits
item.description: A pair of US athletes announce their engagement as Ally Hickman's medal bid turns sour and a dog steals the show at the cross-country skiing. Here are the quick hits from day 12 at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Outback families hope for change amid review into Queensland Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme
item.description: The cost of living is hurting outback residents who need to travel for medical treatment. They say government subsidies need to increase as the price of everything continues to rise.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Channel Nine reporter Danika Mason apologises after viral Today show cross
item.description: Danika Mason has apologised for letting her standards slip during a live cross to the Today show from the Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg tells court Meta no longer designs apps to maximise screen time
item.description: The Meta chief executive's comments were made in a landmark trial over youth social media addiction.

item.title: Home and businesses raided as Darwin NDIA employee arrested for alleged $5m NDIS fraud
item.description: A 47-year-old Darwin public servant has been arrested and charged for allegedly defrauding $5 million from the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

item.title: Midwest farmers want Defence action on explosive risk after fire at Depot Hill wildflower reserve
item.description: Residents are calling for clarity and action over the risk of unexploded WWII ordnance after a popular wildflower reserve was torched in WA's Midwest.

item.title: Brisbane's Lang Park concert cap almost doubles under new trial
item.description: A one-year trial will see the number of concerts at Brisbane's Lang Park almost double from 12 to 21 per year.

item.title: How exclusion orders could ban Australian citizens from returning home indefinitely
item.description: One of the Australian women being held in a Syrian refugee camp has been barred from returning home after being given a temporary exclusion order — but the ban may not be as temporary as the name implies.

item.title: SA secures Australian MotoGP, world-first street circuit announced
item.description: The South Australian government has confirmed the Australian MotoGP will move to Adelaide from 2027, bringing with it huge economic benefits, but the opposition and Greens say the state has other priorities.

item.title: The Kyneton women's football team's story was always about more than just one club
item.description: The women's team from Kyneton's 15-month public and bitter saga suggests it is the canary in the coal mine of a widespread issue for women's players across the country.

item.title: Unemployment rate remains at 4.1pc in January, leading to talk of another rate rise
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate remained at 4.1 per cent in January, with 17,800 more employed people.

item.title: The heartwarming tribute to injured aerials star Laura Peel at the Winter Olympics
item.description: This Winter Olympics aerials competition saw plenty of Aussies achieve lifetime goals, but they never forgot the one person who was missing — injured champion Laura Peel.

item.title: Wayne Gardner disappointed Victoria won't host Australian MotoGP
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Premier Chris Minns questions what went wrong amid Cumberland Hospital patient escapes
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns says it is "deeply distressing" that two mental health patients who escaped from the same Sydney hospital within 24 hours went on to allegedly kill three people between them.

item.title: Alcoa's environmental record 'disappointing' says WA premier after $55m payment for unlawful jarrah forest clearing
item.description: Roger Cook criticises Alcoa's environmental record for being "not at the level we expect", after the US mining giant agreed to pay $55 million for clearing a native jarrah forest in WA's south without approval.

item.title: Adelaide Ice Arena charged after patrons hospitalised for alleged carbon monoxide exposure
item.description: Safework SA has launched criminal proceedings against the Adelaide Ice Arena, after hockey players and spectators were allegedly exposed to "significant levels" of carbon monoxide more than two years ago, leading to more than 40 hospitalisations.

item.title: Heavy rain through north Queensland leads to multiple floodwater rescues and Bruce Highway closures
item.description: Heavy rainfall across north Queensland has led to multiple rescues and the closure of several sections of the Bruce Highway.

item.title: In her memoir, Gisèle Pelicot reveals the secret love behind France's most infamous rape trial
item.description: The world knows Gisèle Pelicot as the woman who waived anonymity during France's most infamous rape trial. But in her new memoir she reveals an unexpected story — the boyfriend she kept hidden and the love that helped her face an open courtroom.

item.title: Rugby fans furious over 2027 Rugby World Cup ticket website crashes
item.description: Rugby fans from around the world are furious after failing to get tickets to the 2027 Men's World Cup due technical glitches and website crashes.

item.title: Free RSV flu vaccine for aged care residents to be rolled out in WA
item.description: After a horror flu season last year, free RSV vaccinations are being rolled out for the first time for older Western Australians living in residential aged care.

item.title: Hanson digs her heels in, Taylor goes on tour
item.description: This week, the new opposition leader revealed his shadow cabinet while Pauline Hanson spun through a cycle she knows well.

item.title: Vegetable scraps to be turned into bioenergy by Scenic Rim farm as part of $291 million project
item.description: A new $291 million project set to turn farm scraps to energy has begun construction in Queensland's Scenic Rim.

item.title: What is Skimo? The sport preparing to steal the show at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Skimo, or ski mountaineering, is coming to the 2026 Winter Olympics. But what is the sport and why is it so exciting?

item.title: Salmon farm antibiotics found in native Tasmanian species kilometres away
item.description: An antibiotic used by the Tasmanian salmon farming industry is detected in native species more than 10km away from the closest fish operation using it.

item.title: Man accused of 'controlling' the lives of Venezuelan youth group granted bail
item.description: An alleged religious leader accused of "controlling every aspect" of the lives of a Venezuelan youth group has been granted release on strict home detention conditions by a South Australian court.

item.title: Police arrest 16yo over stabbing of teen at Geelong shopping centre
item.description: A 16-year-old boy has been arrested following a suspected stabbing at a Geelong shopping centre that left another teen in a critical condition.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 13
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Collingwood apologises after asking elderly members for donations via their wills
item.description: The Magpies have come under fire after a letter campaign asking elderly members to amend their wills to donate to the AFL club.

item.title: Coles manager moved product onto 'Down Down' promotion days after price hike to be more competitive
item.description: A second Coles manager has been grilled in the federal court over whether rushing a product onto a "Down Down" promotion could have broken internal guidelines.

item.title: South Korea's ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol sentenced to life in prison over insurrection
item.description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is sentenced to life in prison on charges of rebellion for his attempt to put the country under military rule.

item.title: Rottnest Channel Swim organisers weigh cancellation as 55 kph winds forecast
item.description: As thousands of people prepare to tackle Western Australia's iconic Rottnest Island Swim, rough weather is threatening to grind it to a halt just 48 hours before it begins.

item.title: Gas explosion kills 16 after apartment building partially collapses in southern Pakistan
item.description: Women and children are among 16 people killed after a gas explosion ripped through an apartment building in Pakistan on Thursday.

item.title: Employees of Albany lolly shop fined for illegal tobacco sales say they were never paid
item.description: "Vulnerable" staff at a smoke shop disguised as a candy store in Albany say they were never paid by the shop's mystery operators.

item.title: Thursday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Have Australian researchers found the secret to treating sepsis?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Abandoned Antarctic base is now a pollution threat
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Michael Brian Becton sentenced to more than 24 years in jail for child sex offences
item.description: Michael Brian Becton, 33, is handed a 24-and-a-half year prison term after pleading guilty to 77 child sexual offences against children and babies. WARNING: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Ally Hickman showed her grit at 2026 Winter Olympics after heavy fall on second run
item.description: In a Winter Olympics beset by both glory and injury, Ally Hickman's heavy fall in the snowboard slopestyle could have turned a happy day into another disappointing one. Instead, the young Aussie showed her grit to get back up and go again.

item.title: Former premier joins community calls for speed reduction at 'dangerous' fatal intersection in Newham
item.description: A community in central Victoria is calling for a 20 kph speed limit reduction at a "terribly dangerous" intersection after four major accidents.

item.title: Sisters Lisa and Rachael Maza reunite on stage for the world premiere of Black Light
item.description: The former head of Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri teams up with her sister Lisa for the world premiere of Black Light, which tells the story of three generations of Blak women.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: Museum robberies, the Lunar New Year and a new shadow cabinet
item.description: It has been a huge week in news. Did you catch these stories?

item.title: Georgia Voll top scores as Australia beats India in second Twenty20 by 19 runs
item.description: The retirement of Alyssa Healy leaves a big hole at the top of the order, but Georgia Voll looks capable of stepping in after a career-best outing in Canberra.

item.title: As electric car prices fall, will affordability win over drivers?
item.description: The price tag of EVs has been a barrier to uptake. As cheaper models hit the market, will more drivers go electric?

item.title: The 2026 South Australia election is here — Have your say about what matters to you
item.description: We want to know what issues matter most to you and what you want us to find out ahead of the March 21, SA election.

item.title: Voters divided as Barnaby Joyce considers contesting New England for One Nation
item.description: One Nation MP Barnaby Joyce says he might recontest his seat of New England as a candidate for One Nation if the party needs him to.

item.title: Youth justice experts warn over-policing of residential care children is 'manufacturing criminals'
item.description: Experts say over-policing and South Australia's youth criminal justice system is helping turn children in residential care into criminals.

item.title: Study to test whether a new helmet will significantly reduce risk of concussion in football players
item.description: A lot of research has gone in to treating concussions, but now scientists are testing a new helmet to see if it can prevent them before they happen.

item.title: Can Angus Taylor get beyond slogans to craft a sound immigration policy?
item.description: The rifts in Australia's social cohesion can be seen in the blow-up over the so-called ISIS brides and their children, who want to come to Australia.

item.title: Wild horse art on birth certificates is 'hypocritical', says brumby welfare group
item.description: A limited-edition birth certificate released to mark the Chinese Year of the Horse is being labelled "hypocritical" as a cull of wild horses continues in the NSW high country.

item.title: Coalition willing to help stop passports for IS-linked women— as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor says the Coalition is willing to help the government strengthen legislation so women with ties to Islamic State are not issued Australian passports.

item.title: Major US fund's credit squeeze could 'blow up' — as it happened
item.description: Shares in US asset manager Blue Owl have fallen sharply after it announced it was having challenges meeting investors' cash demands.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sam Altman and Dario Amodei refuse to hold hands
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor released under investigation after almost 10 hours in custody
item.description: The former Duke of York has been released under investigation by British police, as officers continue to search his former Windsor home.

item.title: Bangarra Dance Theatre wins Golden Lion at international dance festival Venice Danza 2026
item.description: Indigenous dance company Bangarra Dance Theatre has become the first company and first First Nations performers to receive the Golden Lion at Venice Danza, the international festival of contemporary dance.

item.title: Canadian skier Cassie Sharpe's horrific crash in the halfpipe reminds us of Winter Olympics dangers
item.description: As Cassie Sharpe lay motionless on the base of the Livigno halfpipe, the excruciating tension reminded us all that winter Olympians are only ever seconds from disaster.

item.title: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu set to show world leaders climate change impact ahead of COP31
item.description: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu look set to host world leaders and climate change ministers in the lead-up to COP31 in a bid to encourage larger countries to accelerate cuts to emissions.

item.title: Is it OK to feed Australia's wild birds?
item.description: Many of us love interacting with and feeding wild birds, but experts say giving them the wrong types of food can do more harm than good.

item.title: Australian exporters could face windfall if Trump tariffs ruled unlawful by US Supreme Court
item.description: Modelling by consulting firm EY Australia shows Australian exporters would be owed more than $1.4 billion in refunds collectively if the US tariffs are struck down.

item.title: NT cattle sector backs draft buffel grass plan as environmental and Aboriginal groups say it favours industry
item.description: Cattle producers support the NT's draft buffel grass weed management plan, but it has attracted criticism from traditional owners and environmental groups.

item.title: Indra Brown's Winter Olympics medal contention doesn't remove the reality of school homework
item.description: Sixteen-year-old Indra Brown came into the Winter Olympics as one of the top medal contenders in freeski halfpipe — a status elevated since she finished fourth in qualification — but it still doesn't get her out of maths homework.

item.title: Commercial fishing licence buybacks recommended in latest harmful algal bloom report
item.description: Fishing licence buybacks and long-term restocking plans are some of the recommendations in the latest report into South Australia's harmful algal bloom, which has been labelled as "vanilla" by one scientist turned political candidate.

item.title: Eric Dane, star of Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, dies aged 53
item.description: The star was best known for his role as Dr Mark Sloan in long-running medical drama Grey's Anatomy, and as the patriarch of the Jacobs family in teen hit Euphoria.

item.title: The Board of Peace meant to rebuild Gaza may well end up as another monument to Donald Trump
item.description: Unless the Board of Peace begins to focus and genuinely tries to make the world a better place, this may well prove to be yet another monument to Donald Trump.

item.title: Complainant in former Liberal MP Rory Amon's underage sexual assault trial addresses court
item.description: The complainant in the sexual assault trial of former Liberal MP Rory Amon has told a court of the alleged incidents that took place in a car park toilet when he was 13.

item.title: Eileen Gu says JD Vance is 'sweet' for saying she should be competing for US at 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Eileen Gu says she is flattered that JD Vance thinks she should be competing for the US, but feels his comments are driven by an anti-China bias from Washington.

item.title: Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage charged with illegal surveillance by WA Police sex crime division
item.description: Geraldton Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage has been charged with the illegal installation of a surveillance device and unlawful use of a computer by WA sex crime detectives.

item.title: Parents speak at sentencing hearing for Christopher Turner over fatal gas mix-up
item.description: The parents of two babies given nitrous oxide in a fatal gas mix-up at a Sydney hospital almost a decade ago express their pain and trauma at the sentencing hearing for the man responsible.

item.title: Coroner delivers findings into James Tsindos's death from allergic reaction to delivery meal
item.description: A Victorian coroner hands down her findings into the death of a teenager who suffered a severe allergic reaction to a delivery meal — but it's unclear if more urgent treatment would have saved his life.

item.title: Kyra Wheatley ready to ride the chaos and speed of ski cross at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: The speed and chaos of ski cross is what attracted Kyra Wheatley to the sport, and to realise a dream 12 years in the making of competing at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Scientists model best-case and worst-case climate scenarios for Antarctica
item.description: Scientists say parts of Antarctica face "devastating" and "irreversible" impacts from climate change unless urgent action is taken to limit greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: MotoGP Adelaide move raises concerns about rider safety, transport and trees
item.description: A rider, a reporter and a road safety expert say it will be difficult to make it safe for motorcycles to race around the Adelaide Parklands.

item.title: Woman who fatally struck 12-year-old Marshall Oakley-Stagg granted restricted driver's licence
item.description: A driver who struck and killed a 12-year-old boy outside his school in southern Tasmania in 2024 has been granted a restricted licence.

item.title: Port Pirie's toddlers record highest blood lead levels in a decade
item.description: The percentage of two-year-old children above the blood lead level threshold in Port Pirie is the highest in a decade, according to the latest figures.

item.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
item.description: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

item.title: Nurses' strike at Adelaide's Lyell McEwin Hospital cancelled after pay increase ahead of state election start
item.description: The Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation cancels a strike at one of Adelaide's largest public hospitals after securing a 2 per cent pay rise on top of a 4 per cent immediate increase in wages announced earlier this week.

item.title: Queensland's new chief health officer Marianne Gale outlines future priorities
item.description: Marianne Gale reminisces about her time working for Doctors Without Borders to emphasise how she wants to shape the public health of the state – with a strong focus on equity.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Cockroach numbers surge in Adelaide during warm, humid weather
item.description: Adelaide residents have been reporting increased numbers of unwelcome six-legged visitors in their homes, but with humid weather to continue amid a flood warning for the state's north, they are likely to stick around for a while yet.

item.title: Licence for use of antibiotic florfenicol in Tasmanian salmon industry may be suspended
item.description: The federal agency that approved the use of an antibiotic for Tasmania's salmon industry has proposed to suspend that licence, in the wake of news the antibiotic has been found in native species.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Tropical low hovering over the NT
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Rottnest Channel Swim cancelled due to strong winds, choppy seas
item.description: Perth's iconic Rottnest Channel Swim has been cancelled as forecast strong winds and unfavourable ocean conditions leaves thousands of swimmers and support crew disappointed.

item.title: Police receive 'reports of crime' in relation to Pauline Hanson interview
item.description: One Nation senator Pauline Hanson accuses the government of trying to put her "back in jail", after police received reports of a crime in relation to the senator's inflammatory comments about Muslims during a media interview.

item.title: Rain bands sweep over southeast Australia
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Norway sets Winter Olympics record with 17th gold medal
item.description: Norway breaks its own record for the most gold medals won by a nation at a single Winter Olympics.

item.title: Trump wants federal agencies to release files on UFOs and extraterrestrials
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he will direct federal agencies to begin "identifying and releasing" government files related to UFOs and aliens.

item.title: Dolphins defeat New Zealand Warriors in NRL trial, Jackson Ford sin-bin for hip-drop tackle
item.description: The New Zealand Warriors' hopes of having no-nonsense forward Jackson Ford on deck for their season opener are in the hands of the NRL's match review committee after he was sin-binned in a 38-34 trial loss to the Dolphins.

item.title: NSW Waratahs defeat Fijian Drua in Super Rugby Pacific round two, Pete Samu plays after birth of child
item.description: Wallabies veteran Pete Samu has helped the NSW Waratahs to consecutive wins to start the Super Rugby Pacific season, just hours after the birth of his child.

item.title: Australia blows Oman away to end T20 World Cup campaign with a bang
item.description: Australia has flogged Oman, chasing down 105 in less than 10 overs to end a disappointing World Cup campaign on a high. Follow live.

item.title: Man whose girlfriend froze to death after he left her mountain convicted of manslaughter
item.description: A man who left his girlfriend to freeze to death on an Austrian mountain has been handed a five-month suspended sentence for manslaughter.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's estate agrees to pay up to $US35 million to settle class action
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's estate has agreed to pay as much as $US35 million to resolve a class action lawsuit, according to a court filing on Thursday.

item.title: Trump vows to resurrect global tariffs after Supreme Court strikes them down
item.description: The US president says he is "absolutely ashamed" of members of the court who struck down his global tariffs after finding he lacked the authority to implement them.

item.title: Putin is betting Ukraine and the West run out of resources first
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is betting that the West and Ukraine will run out of resources first.

item.title: Should Labor do its own refresh after Angus Taylor's Liberal 'rebrand'?
item.description: In the past few days, in a series of largely ignored milestones overshadowed by news of Angus Taylor's new frontbench, Albanese overtook Scott Morrison and John Curtin to become the 12th-longest serving prime minister.

item.title: Andy Griffiths, author of the Treehouse books, named new Australian Children's Laureate
item.description: Famous for writing stories about toilets and tree houses, the bestselling kids' author is taking on a new challenge on the national stage.

item.title: Tell us what is going on in grassroots footy
item.description: Do you have a story about the culture at a footy netball club in your community? ABC Regional Investigations wants to hear from you.

item.title: The town that turned its back on a rape victim
item.description: A local footy star and his mate are convicted of raping their friend. In the tiny town of Balmoral, where the footy club reigns, the town makes it clear whose story they believe.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's future uncertain under monarch willing to let 'the law take its course'
item.description: Like so many of the elite caught in Epstein's web, Andrew believed he would escape scrutiny for his behaviour. But it is precisely because of his name and position that his alleged wrongdoing has now delivered him into the hands of the law.

item.title: Why Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging Russia's fleet of 'shadow tankers'
item.description: Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging vessels on their shipping registries after gaining international attention for their role in Russia's "shadow fleet".

item.title: Nathan Cleary facing two-match suspension over high hit in Panthers' trial loss to Wests Tigers
item.description: Nathan Cleary can accept a two-match suspension with an early plea after his high hit on Wests Tigers star Heamasi Makasini.

item.title: Scientists recommend succulents to protect buildings from bushfires
item.description: As bushfires become more frequent, scientists say garden beds can be a line of defence.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Peregrine falcon drone could save Australian fruit and almond orchards from hungry birds
item.description: A new falcon drone wards off peckish birds that have been destroying valuable fruit crops.

item.title: Manchester United owner Jim Ratcliffe avoids sanctions after saying UK has been 'colonised' by immigrants
item.description: Jim Ratcliffe is reminded of his responsibilities as a participant in English football but is not handed any penalties from FA after his controversial call.

item.title: Man and 15yo boy charged over shooting of former NRL player Matt Utai
item.description: Police allege a 25-year-old man was responsible for the shooting of former NRL player Matt Utai, while a 15-year-old drove the getaway car.

item.title: Research sparks renewed calls for needle exchange programs to be introduced in Australian prisons
item.description: Researchers and advocates are calling for needle exchange programs to be introduced in prisons to help combat the risks of sharing needles and using unsafe devices to inject illicut drugs.

item.title: Community Emergency Response Team volunteer paramedics fill care gap
item.description: In parts of rural and remote New South Wales, groups of volunteers are brushing up on high-level first aid skills to become first responders when an ambulance crew cannot.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn goes 'bionic' as the curling war of words continues — day 14 quick hits
item.description: Swedish curler Oskar Eriksson hits Canadian nemesis Marc Kennedy with his most devastating barb yet as Lindsey Vonn shares an update on her recovery. Here are the quick hits from day 14 at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Queensland woman wakes from coma after contracting meningitis and septic shock on ski holiday to Japan
item.description: When 24-year-old Anna Gallo woke up shivering in a Tokyo hotel, she thought it was food poisoning. Hours later, she was in a coma fighting for her life against a disease she thought she was vaccinated against.

item.title: North Queensland on high alert as deluge continues and rivers rise
item.description: Flooding is likely to become more widespread in northern and western Queensland over the next few days, with further heavy rainfall and road closures expected.

item.title: Bayern Munich coach Vincent Kompany says José Mourinho made 'huge mistake' attacking Vinícius Júnior's character after alleged racist insult
item.description: Bayern Munich manager Vincent Kompany dissects the racism row involving Real Madrid and Brazil star Viní Jr with a passionate 12-minute speech.

item.title: Herby potato salad with green beans and tuna - ABC News
item.description: Turn a potato salad into a tasty meal with pantry staples and fresh greens.

item.title: Opposition does its best to land blows on WA government in parliament's first week back
item.description: Housing, health and household stress — that's what WA's opposition leader says he's focused on in 2026 as he and his party face an uphill battle against the state government.

item.title: Why economists hate low unemployment for inflation
item.description: The theory goes that if you have just the right amount of workers on the unemployment scrap heap, you can keep inflation in check. The problem is that no-one knows exactly what the magic unemployment rate is.

item.title: Potential release of carp control virus into waterways delayed until 2028
item.description: Release of a virus to control carp in Australian waterways has been delayed until 2028, a decade after it was initially slated for release.

item.title: How Reuters captured that photo of former Prince Andrew leaving custody
item.description: The image, taken by Reuters photographer Phil Noble, went viral when it was published on Thursday. He says capturing the moment came down to a tip-off and more than a little luck.

item.title: I had a miscarriage over the summer. It was nothing like I expected
item.description: My understanding of miscarriage was built on a handful of Hollywood representations and snatches of stories I'd read. Outside of this, I had few reference points.

item.title: Adam Zampa says claims Australia does not care about T20 cricket 'totally false' after World Cup flop
item.description: Adam Zampa hits back at claims that Australia does not care about T20 cricket after a disappointing World Cup campaign.

item.title: How a window opened for IS-linked Australians to leave Syria
item.description: After holding a large swathe of autonomous territory that included two detention camps, Kurdish-led forces are now reluctantly handing over control to Syrian government forces, following their successful military offensive.

item.title: The shamans and designer handbags before Yoon Suk Yeol's insurrection conviction
item.description: Former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol's sentence for insurrection comes after a tumultuous era of shamanism, Chanel bags and conspiracy theories.

item.title: How a Belgian techno producer with some old synthesisers has reimagined Terminator 2
item.description: Terminator 2: Judgment Day is getting the live score treatment, but not in the way you might expect.

item.title: Viral AI videos raise questions about how we view reality
item.description: For a bit of a laugh, Travis Marshall uses artificial intelligence to create wacky videos about his hometown, but his light-hearted content also raises serious questions about reality in the age of AI.

item.title: NASA boss blasts Boeing and agency over bungled test flight that left astronauts stranded on space station
item.description: A bungled Boeing mission that left two astronauts stranded on the International Space Station for nine months has been criticised by NASA's new boss.

item.title: Drugs with estimated street value of $1.45 million seized in traffic stop
item.description: A traffic stop on the Pacific Highway on the NSW Mid North Coast has led to the seizure of hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of cocaine and cannabis, police say.

item.title: The US Supreme Court's take-down of Trump's tariffs explained
item.description: The ruling on tariffs is a hugely consequential decision that has infuriated the president, who is now looking for workarounds.

item.title: Punch the baby macaque draws a crowd at Japan's Ichikawa City Zoo
item.description: The six month old macaque's relationship with a soft toy orangutan has become an internet sensation.

item.title: Man charged after allegedly throwing 'lit incendiary device' during Navy chief's speech
item.description: A man faces court accused of throwing a fake explosive device through a Canberra hotel window during a speech from the Chief of Navy.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on day 15
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Formula 1 preseason testing: Ferrari has a rotating rear wing, Red Bull, McLaren and Mercedes show pace
item.description: Preseason testing for the new Formula 1 season ends in Bahrain, with teams not putting their cars on a track until the first practice session of the Australian Grand Prix weekend on March 6.

item.title: Rottnest Swim cancellation prompts dozens to descend on Perth pool
item.description: Weather may have derailed the main event, but some swimmers were determined to complete their own version of the Rottnest Channel Swim in the name of charity.

item.title: Auckland FC defeat Wellington Phoenix 5-0 in A-League Men, goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi own goal begins rout
item.description: Wellington Phoenix goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi commits one of the worst howlers this A-League Men season, heading a clearance kick into his own net as Auckland FC romps to a big win.

item.title: South Australian election countdown officially begins, campaign kicks off
item.description: Election campaigning in South Australia is officially underway, with candidates seizing the opportunity to begin making their formal pitches to voters before they head to the ballot box in March.

item.title: Walker and Reddingius create Aussie Olympic bobsleigh history
item.description: Bree Walker and Kiara Reddingius achieve Australia's best Olympic result in two-woman bobsleigh, as teenager Indra Brown is forced to wait for her chance to compete for a medal.

item.title: Gout Gout sets another record with 10-second 100m sprint in Brisbane
item.description: Australian sprinting sensation Gout Gout comes perilously close to breaking the 10-second barrier, with another eye-catching run in Brisbane.

item.title: Hong Kong offers buy-out scheme for owners who lost homes in last year's deadly apartment fire
item.description: After a deadly Hong Kong fire that killed 168 people and left thousands homeless in November, authorities have announced a buy-out offer for owners.

item.title: Hungary and Slovakia threaten Ukraine over stalled Russian oil shipments
item.description: Hungary and Slovakia, which have both received a temporary exemption from an EU policy prohibiting imports of Russian oil, have accused Ukraine of deliberately holding up supplies.

item.title: Danielle Scott, Cooper Woods named as Winter Olympic Games closing ceremony flag-bearers
item.description: Two of Australia's 2026 Winter Olympic Games medallists, Cooper Woods and Danielle Scott, will carry the flag at the closing ceremony in Verona.

item.title: Albanese government bears inflation pressure while premiers spend big, poll well
item.description: High-spending premiers remain popular and seemingly impervious to the rising cost-of-living anxiety piling pressure on the Albanese government.

item.title: Bridgerton's Yerin Ha is living her own Cinderella story
item.description: Yerin Ha built a name for herself in local and international productions for almost a decade before transforming into Bridgerton's newest paramour.

item.title: On the frontlines of Australia's fight against vaccine hesitancy
item.description: With immunisation rates declining and outbreaks of infectious diseases like measles increasing, the consequences of vaccine hesitancy in Australia are becoming clearer.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Think you're a trivia boss? Show us what you've got
item.description: Well, this is cute — you thinking you're a quiz pro. It's time to play … HARD!

item.title: More assault allegations surface against footballers in tiny town of Balmoral
item.description: More women come forward with allegations of sexual assault in a small Victorian town, years after a rape victim was shunned by the town.

item.title: Donald Trump hikes global tariff rate to 15pc after Supreme Court loss
item.description: Donald Trump says he will raise to 15 per cent the global tariff he imposed after the US Supreme Court ruled against previous tariffs.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was the Queen's rumoured favourite. Did she do too much to protect him?
item.description: It will be up to King Charles to shepherd his family's institution through its darkest hour. But could his own mother have done more to snuff out this crisis before he inherited it?

item.title: Predator Jeffrey Epstein used promises of university scholarships and modelling contracts to lure victims
item.description: Admission into elite universities. A job that promised travel around the world. An audition for Victoria's Secret. This is how Jeffery Epstein lured his victims.

item.title: A visual guide to the prices that landed Coles in court
item.description: The pricing patterns of these six products show how Coles stands accused of using its Down Down marketing campaign to dupe shoppers.

item.title: Scammers fleeced pensioner Ian Williams out of $1,338. So he sued his bank for $379 million
item.description: Ian Williams has brought a whole new meaning to "taking on the big guy". When scammers stole from the pensioner the bank blamed him. So he launched a $379 million lawsuit to "make it right".

item.title: The Miracle on Ice, when an unheralded USA team knocked off the mighty USSR
item.description: On this day in 1980, a group of American students pulled off the most unlikely of victories, beating the greatest team in international ice hockey history in the upset of the century. Some even called it a miracle.

item.title: Doctors race through Kyiv missile strike to deliver child's donor heart
item.description: Kyiv surgeons who drove through a massive missile strike to deliver a child's donor heart say they will stop at nothing to save lives — even when under attack.

item.title: Coastal communities weigh costs and potential retreat as erosion batters SA's Limestone Coast
item.description: With costs and damage mounting, councils are considering all options, including pulling back from the beaches.

item.title: Australian underdogs edged out of mixed aerials team medals at 2026 Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Australia goes desperately close to an underdog medal in the mixed team aerials competitions at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games.

item.title: India claims series win over Australia in Ellyse Perry's historic 350th international match
item.description: There is no fairytale for Ellyse Perry in her 350th international match as Smriti Mandhana stars to lead India to a series win over Australia.

item.title: SA Labor mulls One Nation's rise as Liberals fight for campaign oxygen
item.description: In the final week before the election writs were issued, the SA Premier trained his sights on One Nation while the Liberals fought for oxygen. Is it a sign of the campaign ahead?

item.title: Patients three times more likely to escape from Cumberland Hospital, data shows
item.description: Cumberland Hospital is under investigation after two patients who escaped from its care within 24 hours allegedly caused three people's deaths.

item.title: Daly Cherry-Evans and Sam Walker show promising signs as Eels down Roosters in NRL trial
item.description: Daly Cherry-Evans shows immediate signs of a strong combination with new Roosters halves mate Sam Walker in his first match for his new NRL club.

item.title: Cawleys Bridge retrofit reconnects wildlife habitat above Princes Motorway
item.description: A forgotten bridge over one of the busiest commuter routes in NSW is being reborn as a safe crossing for wildlife.

item.title: After 20 years as the only town listed on the NSW State Heritage Registry, Braidwood is at a turning point
item.description: A walk along the main street of this town is stepping in the footsteps of bushrangers, movie stars, artists and migrants.

item.title: Farmers on tenterhooks as trade deal with the European Union edges closer
item.description: Australia is on the cusp of signing a landmark free trade deal with the EU, but will it come at a cost?

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Wild Livigno weather puts Indra Brown's medal tilt on hold — day 15 quick hits
item.description: Indra Brown's medal tilt is put on hold as a horror bobsleigh crash and wild weather rock day 15. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo becomes first athlete to win six gold medals at one Winter Olympics
item.description: Johannes Høsflot Klæbo adds to his legacy as the greatest Winter Olympian of all-time by winning his sixth gold of these Olympics and 11th overall.

item.title: Police searching for kidnapped man Chris Baghsarian investigate suspicious car fires
item.description: Police are probing a 2022 model Toyota Corolla, bearing a Victorian number plate, reported stolen from a Victorian address in January.

item.title: Massive goat trap in remote WA merges new technology and old ideas
item.description: When their station's fragile landscape needed protection from feral goats, Calum and Belinda Carruth seized on an idea that has become marvel of technology and pest management.

item.title: Punk's boom began 50 years ago in Brisbane — and the scene is still thriving
item.description: The Saints released their single "(I'm) Stranded" in 1976, kicking off the punk movement in Australia. So how did it all unfold?

item.title: SA Water to run Coober Pedy network in bid to bring down high water bills
item.description: SA Water will take over the decrepit water infrastructure in Coober Pedy, where burst pipes have led to residents paying some of the highest water bills in the state.

item.title: Bodies of nine back-country skiers recovered days after California avalanche
item.description: The bodies of nine back-country skiers killed in a California avalanche four days earlier are recovered, following a harrowing operation hindered by intense snowfall.

item.title: Miner MMG puts forward alternative Rosebery tailings dam site in Exe Valley
item.description: Global mining company MMG has long been seeking to build a third tailings storage dam at its mine on the Tasmanian west coast, in the face of strong opposition from environmentalists. It's now put forward an alternative which conservationists say they won't fight.

item.title: UK passport changes leave Australians with dual citizenship scrambling before border rules kick in
item.description: There's been a last-minute scramble for some Australians with dual British or Irish citizenship, as new UK border rules come into force within days.

item.title: What is the bare minimum when it comes to packing kids' lunch boxes?
item.description: This is the bare minimum you should aim for to cover the nutritional basics for your children's school lunches.

item.title: Rap program aims to reduce reoffending among young people in custody
item.description: The musical genre is helping young offenders at a juvenile detention centre in southern NSW find their voices.

item.title: British nuclear-powered attack sub HMS Anson arrives in Perth for training exercises
item.description: The two countries are expected to conduct AUKUS pillar 2 tests while HMS Anson is within Australian waters.

item.title: Child psychiatrist Benjamin Wen indecently touched boys while doing 'puberty checks', court told
item.description: A former child psychiatrist who changed his name after being convicted of child exploitation touched young neurodivergent boys indecently at his practice, a Perth court hears. WARNING: This story contains details that may distress some readers.

item.title: Eating disorder clinic to open near Mandurah as frustration grows over residential facility
item.description: As an eating disorder clinic prepares to open its doors near Mandurah south of Perth, a residential eating disorder clinic is still in the planning stages despite being on the cards for years.

item.title: Minister reveals process has started to ban Hizb ut-Tahrir under new hate laws
item.description: Tony Burke has also provided an update on the cohort of 34 Australians seeking to leave a Syrian refugee camp.

item.title: Inside the trend of renovating old churches on the Darling Downs
item.description: A small timber church built in 1917 is at the centre of a growing trend reshaping the future of regional sacred spaces.

item.title: Alisa Camplin-Warner calls for more funding after historic 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Australia's chef de mission Alisa Camplin-Warner says the successful team deserve more funding for future Games.

item.title: What the Bad Bunny in Australia tour means for Puerto Ricans far from home
item.description: This weekend Bad Bunny offers Australia a lesson in community, identity and how to belong without diluting your true self.

item.title: Great-grandmother's garlic mushroom artwork puts new spin on managing food waste
item.description: Meet the country artist putting a slightly unexpected spin on garlic mushrooms.

item.title: First Nations leaders call for federal treaty and truth-telling to follow Victoria's lead
item.description: First Nations leaders, Elders and advocates are urging the federal government to commit to a national treaty and truth-telling process, labelling some states as "hostile" to the notion.

item.title: Handmade patchwork quilts bring comfort to Taree palliative care patients and their families
item.description: Over a decade, more than 2,000 quilts have been made for palliative care patients in Taree. The powerful gesture brings dignity and comfort, and a tangible memory for families.

item.title: After a rare Supreme Court loss for Trump, here's his record with the bench
item.description: Donald Trump was furious when the US Supreme Court ruled that his use of tariffs was illegal. Here's how earlier cases in that jurisdiction have fared.

item.title: ABC voices from the past look to its bright future on 102.5FM.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Migraine is more than just a headache. A neurologist explains the four stages
item.description: Knowing the four distinct phases of a migraine can help you recognise the symptoms and manage pain at each stage.

item.title: Rescue operation carried out after multiple boats capsize during Bellerive Regatta
item.description: A gust of wind caused at least eight boats to capsize in the River Derwent during a race.

item.title: Why has Donald Trump issued Keir Starmer a warning about the Chagos Islands?
item.description: The US president has told the UK it is making a "big mistake" in its decision to transfer sovereignty of the islands to Mauritius.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on day 16
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Hundreds of 'toxic' poppies stolen from Victorian farm triggers health department alert
item.description: About 1,700 poppy plants grown for the pharmaceutical industry have been stolen from a regional property north-west of Melbourne, prompting a warning from the state health department.

item.title: British nuclear-powered submarine docks in WA
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Labor launches SA election campaign with land and housing promises
item.description: SA Labor's state election campaign launch is framed around housing, with the premier committing to a scheme for the purchase of land that would then be on-sold to the private sector for development.

item.title: How construction corruption is affecting housing affordability
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Third mental health patient absconds from Cumberland Hospital
item.description: Madan Pandey absconds from Cumberland Hospital, days after two men escaped from the same facility and later allegedly killed three people.

item.title: Alice Springs prepares for possible flooding amid severe weather warning
item.description: Alice Springs residents and businesses prepare for possible flooding, amid a severe weather warning, and after flash flooding caused the Todd River to rise dramatically last week.

item.title: Nathan Cleary to risk missing first three Panthers games by challenging ban at NRL judiciary
item.description: Nathan Cleary will either be available to play Brisbane in round one or will miss the opening three rounds after Penrith decided to challenge his high tackle ban.

item.title: East West rail corridor cut by flooding amid heavy rain in northern SA
item.description: The cross-country rail line connecting Australia's east and west has been closed after heavy rain and flash flooding washed away significant sections of track, the corridor's manager says.

item.title: Live: Aussie teen Indra Brown in the medal hunt on last day of Winter Olympics
item.description: Australian 16-year-old Indra Brown is in the freeski halfpipe final on the last day of the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games. Follow live.
